reviewText: youve heard them talk about it on tv for years,the time hbk drew #1 and then won the royal rumble!this is it!this is the tape where he does it!that should be enough right there but ill tell the rest also.1-theres a very long and aggravating match only mike rotundos mother could love where he survives against the undertaker for a long time exclusively by cheap shots.2-theres a lame tag team title match where the 123 kid and bob holly wrestle tatanka and bam bam biegelow.this match was stupid.i cant belive 123 kid and bob holly were even high school champions much less tag team champs in the wwe[then wwf].theres the initial showdown between lt and bam bam afterwards that led to thier eventual wrestlemania showdown.3-scott hall goes up against jeff jarrett.another snoozer.i cant belive these 2 losers were battling for the ic title.no wonder the wwe was struggling so much then.they save it with the title match though.4-kevin nash fights bret hart for like freaking ever in a classic!SPOILER WARNING!!!!!!!!!!!at the end of this match,theyd both battled so long they were barely moving due to exhaustion.then a whole bunch of the other contenders came out and stomped them both down!5-then came the rumble.this year a few things changed!1-only 1 minute between entreants so more action in less time!2-the winner gets pamela anderson for 3 months until wrestlemania and 3-hbk goes coast to coast.basicly,the bulldog and hbk rule until about halfway when,after eliminating everyone,they get a few big guys in and a big big fight ensues as the ring refills.bret hart beats a few guys down as revenge for earlier.there are many many short stays.lex lugar gets in and stomps butts for the second half with krush.ultimately,hbk and bulldog fight[the 1st 2 guys].it was really cool!
summary: the one where hbk goes coast to coast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Im not going lie, 1995 was the year WWF should have died. So many crappy gimmicks, Todd Pettingal and Stephaine something as interviewers, a bad world champion. Not much went well for the company but they survived somehow. Here is the first PPV of the dreadful year and its not much better.Pam Anderson enters in a limo and all the WWF superstars go ga ga for her. I cant believe they let that dork Todd Pettingmen in her dressing room.Jeff Jarrett VS Razor Ramon: Jarrett wins via count out but he wants a clear winner. Match restarts and it doesn't get any better. Razor does a good job of selling a knee injury as he cannot perform the Razor's edge and Jarrett rolls him up for the pin. A weak finish but a good acting job by Ramon.Undertaker VS IRS: A dreadful match. Undertaker may be a legend but his early years sure had alot of crappy matches. IRS is a talented wrestler but this match sucked. King Kong Bundy attacks Taker after the match, which set up there WrestleMania encounter that year. By the way, the match was awful as well.Bret Hart VS Diesel: A great match but then Shawn Michaels ruins the match by attacking Diesel. It is restarted and things start flowing again and everything is going well. Hitman is going nuts and almost has the champion tapping out but Owen Hart comes in and attacks Bret Hart. God I miss Owen. The match restarts once again after this happens, so its a no DQ match? Then Bob Backlund, Owen Hart, Double J, Roadie, and HBK attack but Diesel and Bret Hart and this classic match went down the tubes. It's called a draw? Are you friggin kidding me? They'd have a much better and clearer match at Survivor Series that year. A good match ruined by outside interference.1-2-3 Kid and Bob Holly VS Tatanka and Bam Bam Bigelow: WWE should do a dvd dedicated to Bigelow, he was a great worker. This match sucked and the ending was beyond words. Tatanka accidentally knocks Bigelow off the top rope and he lays still for almost five minutes. Kid rolls over and covers him for the win. Just writing me makes it mad.Royal Rumble: Here's a good list of why WWF sucked in 95. Only a few men are above midcard talent (HBK, Bulldog, Owen) and the rest are life time jobbers. I guess you could make a case for Luger but I think he sucks.Overall, skip this event. It was a bad year for wrestling and this is proof. The world title match was the only good match but the ending and outside interference ruined the match.
Title: N/A

reviewText: An excellent Royal Rumble with the angle being that the gorgeous Pamela Anderson would accompany the winner to "Wrestlemania" for their World Title match.The supporting card was exceptional as well as we got to see Razor Ramon defend the Intercontinental Title against Jeff Jarrett, the finals of the Tag Team Title tournament, and Diesel vs. Bret Hart in a World Title match with a whole lot of false endings. This Rumble also featured the infamous altercation with Bam Bam Bigelow and Lawrence Taylor which set up the "Wrestlemania" main event. Not to mention, you also got to see the beautiful Pam at ringside during the Rumble.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's not great but pretty good. The best match was the Royal Rumble match mainly because HBK ultimately won the bout despite bring the first one in & the new 60 second waiting point hurt the match. The worst match was The Undertaker-IRS match which was a dud. The World championship bout between Diesel(Kevin Nash) & Bret Hart while not a bad match,the ending to that fight was inconclusive & frustrating to say the very least. The rest were not great but still pretty good solid matches. I give this event a 6 out of 10.

reviewText: This is the greatest Royal Rumble of all time in my opinion. It is often looked over, but I think it definitely holds water when compared to other ones. Shawn Michaels enters number 1 and wins the entire Rumble, something that had not been previously done. Razor Ramon and Double J Jeff Jarrett open the pay-per-view with an astounding Intercontinental Championship Match. This match happens to be my personal favorite match of all time. It has to be restarted when Razor gets counted out after getting attacked from behind by The Roadie. (Roadie would later become the Road Dogg.) Jarrett winds up taking advantage of the restart and captures the title. Another important focus of the event is then Baywatch star Pamela Anderson promising to accompany the winner of the match to the main event at Wrestlemania. Todd Pettengill takes part in a pretty funny skit from Pam's dressing room in which she changes clothes behind a partition, while Todd sits on her couch and is all flustered and embarrassed. The Undertaker battles I.R.S., setting up a match with King Kong Bundy for the upcoming Wrestlemania. The 1-2-3 Kid and Bob "Spark Plug" Holly face off with Bam Bam Bigelow and Tatanka for the vacant WWF Tag Team Championship. At the end, following his team's loss, Bam Bam angrily pushes NFL star Lawrence Taylor down, setting up a Wrestlemania 11 match. Bret "the Hitman" Hart and Big Daddy Cool Diesel battle in their second and probably finest of an eventual 4 WWF Title matches. The match has to be restarted several times, thanks to interference by Shawn Michaels, Bob Backlund, and Owen Hart. Finally, the Rumble is the real topper, and a great ending to a stellar pay-per-view. Plus, Todd Pettengill gives strategy codes for various older video games at the end, just like he did on many of these older tapes. He actually does something a little different on this tape that you commonly don't see on other tapes. He comes on before the event starts and informs everybody that he will be back at the tape's conclusion. If you are a big time collector, or just an occasional buyer, you need to add this tape to your collection. If you buy it, no matter what number of tapes you have, you will certainly be adding a touch of class to it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Usually, when reviewing old WWF wrestling events, one of my main complaints is that (at times) the technical wrestling is quite shoddy and the Royal Rumble platform is only used as a vehicle towards Wrestlemania.  In the case of the '95 RR, however, that was not the case.  The storylines were interesting, and the wrestling was decent, but still the company at that time lacked one key ingredient...a stable of stars to keep the card interesting from beginning to end.On this card, the Hart-Diesel confrontation is very exciting, The Undertaker (against I.R.S.) gives another nice performance, and the Rumble event itself may be one of the best ever just based on the last few minutes alone!  Sadly, that's all the show has to offer.  Besides Hart, Undertaker, Shawn Michaels, and Razor Ramon (who in this tape is paired with the dreadful Jeff Jarrett), there is no one else to offer any excitement to the rest of the broadcast...just a bunch of fat guys and jobbers.  While watching, I found myself thinking back to the RR's of the late 1980s and early 1990s, when it seemed like every single match brought the fans to their feat multiple times.  Boy, how the mighty had fallen by '95, considering how the entrance of "Adam Bomb" (a very forgettable character) got the biggest charge out of the crowd all night.  It was almost as if the fans were desperate to cheer for something, not being thrilled by the action put before them.One positive, though, is the commentary of Vince McMahon.  Say what you want about his personal life and how he runs his company (and I would be the first to give him the "Stone Cold Salute"), but he sure is more exciting than having to sit through Bobby "The Brain" Heenan for three hours.  Announcers are such a big part of professional wrestling (as they really help to inflame passions among viewers) that this is one of the few steps up from previous years.Overall, I would recommend heavy utilization of the "Fast Forward" button on your remote while watching this one.  Watch Hart, 'Taker, and the end of the Rumble...everything else is pure dreck.
Title: N/A
